From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

English

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Southern England):(file)

Adjective

[edit]

calcular (not comparable)

  1. (medicine) Relating to a calculus.
    a calcular deposit

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin calculāre. By surface analysis, càlcul +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [kəl.kuˈla]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [kal.kuˈlaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

calcular (first-person singular present calculo, first-person singular preterite calculí, past participle calculat)

  1. (transitive) to calculate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of calcular (first conjugation)
infinitive calcular
gerund calculant
past participle masculine feminine
singular calculat calculada
plural calculats calculades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present calculo calcules calcula calculem calculeu calculen
imperfect calculava calculaves calculava calculàvem calculàveu calculaven
future calcularé calcularàs calcularà calcularem calculareu calcularan
preterite calculí calculares calculà calculàrem calculàreu calcularen
conditional calcularia calcularies calcularia calcularíem calcularíeu calcularien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present calculi calculis calculi calculem calculeu calculin
imperfect calculés calculessis calculés calculéssim calculéssiu calculessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — calcula calculi calculem calculeu calculin
negative (no) — no calculis no calculi no calculem no calculeu no calculin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • calculable

Related terms

[edit]
  • càlcul
  • calculació
  • calculador

Further reading

[edit]
  • “calcular” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.
  • “calcular” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “calcular”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “calcular”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin calculō, calculāre.

Verb

[edit]

calcular (first-person singular present calculo, first-person singular preterite calculei, past participle calculado)

  1. to calculate

Conjugation

[edit]

[edit]

  • “calcular”, in Dicionário Estraviz de galego (in Galician), 2014–2025

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin calculāre, from calculus (“pebble”), diminutive of calx (“limestone”), from Ancient Greek χάλιξ (khálix, “pebble”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kaw.kuˈla(ʁ)/ [kaʊ̯.kuˈla(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kaw.kuˈla(ʁ)/ [kaʊ̯.kuˈla(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /kaw.kuˈla(ɾ)/ [kaʊ̯.kuˈla(ɾ)]
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /kaw.kuˈla(ʁ)/ [kaʊ̯.kuˈla(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /kaw.kuˈla(ɻ)/ [kaʊ̯.kuˈla(ɻ)]
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kal.kuˈlaɾ/ [kaɫ.kuˈlaɾ]
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kal.kuˈlaɾ/ [kaɫ.kuˈlaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /kal.kuˈla.ɾi/ [kaɫ.kuˈla.ɾi]

  • Audio (Brazil (Caipira)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: cal‧cu‧lar

Verb

[edit]

calcular (first-person singular present calculo, first-person singular preterite calculei, past participle calculado)

  1. (transitive, mathematics) calculate (determine value)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of calcular (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / vocês)
Infinitive
Impersonal calcular
Personal calcular calculares calcular calcularmos calculardes calcularem
Gerund
calculando
Past participle
Masculine calculado calculados
Feminine calculada calculadas
Indicative
Present calculo calculas calcula calculamos calculais calculam
Imperfect calculava calculavas calculava calculávamos calculáveis calculavam
Preterite calculei calculaste calculou calculamos1, calculámos2 calculastes calcularam
Pluperfect calculara calcularas calculara calculáramos calculáreis calcularam
Future calcularei calcularás calculará calcularemos calculareis calcularão
Conditional calcularia calcularias calcularia calcularíamos calcularíeis calculariam
Subjunctive
Present calcule calcules calcule calculemos calculeis calculem
Imperfect calculasse calculasses calculasse calculássemos calculásseis calculassem
Future calcular calculares calcular calcularmos calculardes calcularem
Imperative
Affirmative calcula calcule calculemos calculai calculem
Negative (não) não calcules não calcule não calculemos não calculeis não calculem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

For quotations using this term, see Citations:calcular.

Further reading

  • “calcular”, in Dicionário inFormal (in Portuguese), 2006–2025
  • “calcular” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “calcular”, in Dicionário infopédia da Lingua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Porto: Porto Editora, 2003–2025

  • “calcular”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Romansch

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • calculer (Puter)

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin calculō, calculāre (“calculate”), from calculus (“pebble”), diminutive of calx (“limestone”), from Ancient Greek χάλιξ (khálix, “pebble”).

Verb

[edit]

calcular

  1. (Rumantsch Grischun, Sursilvan, Sutsilvan, Surmiran, Vallader) to calculate

Derived terms

[edit]
  • calculader (Sursilvan, Rumantsch Grischun)
  • calculatour (Surmiran)
  • calculatur (Sutsilvan, Puter, Vallader)

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin calculāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kalkuˈlaɾ/ [kal.kuˈlaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: cal‧cu‧lar

Verb

[edit]

calcular (first-person singular present calculo, first-person singular preterite calculé, past participle calculado)

  1. (transitive) to calculate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of calcular (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

gerund calculando
past participle masculine feminine
singular calculado calculada
plural calculados calculadas
singular plural

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
